English: This decision shows all new optional decisions to tweak and change the game's behaviour from vanilla HPM. This, along with all decisions it enables, will disappear when you use the decision to hide it to reduce clutter.
This will hide all optional new features.
This will enable new features and disable some unbalanced options for multiplayer.
This will hide all optional new features.

Crimeamod is a mod for Victoria 2 which has very good AI, one given reason for this is, in the mod AI countries can't subsidize their unprofitable factories, which the AI has a tendancy to expand until it bankrupts itself. The AI seems to use the Extra money to have a bigger military, so use this option if you want to try a AI which will prioritize military spending. From my testing in the very late game industry tends to concentrate into the top industrial powers and other AI's can struggle to break into the market.
This will turn off Crimeamod Style Subsidies
This will turn off Crimeamod style subsidies. Use this if you accidentlly enabled it before.
This will cause infamy for everyone to be lower, usually used in a multiplayer setting.
This will reset infamy to vanilla decay.
Infamy is decaying at a faster rate.

This mode will enable you to build/close/expand new factories and micro your economy like Victoria 3, at least as much as Victoria II allows you too... This will require a mounth tick before having any effect.
This will turn off Victoria 3 mode and return you to Victoria II, where economic pollicy matters. This will require a mounth tick before having any effect.
Take the capital state of a country
Force a §Ycountry§W to secede its capital to form a concession.
Demand that $RECIPIENT$ secede their capital to form a concession.
Transfer a state or colonial region to another country with no effect on infamy, prestige, or jingoism
This will cause an event to prevent the UK from forming an alliance with other great powers until either after 1870, Germany forms, or the UK is no longer the 1st place great power.
This will disable an event to prevent the UK from forming an alliance with other great powers until either after 1870, Germany forms, or the UK is no longer the 1st place great power.

This will cause an event to prevent Russia from forming an alliance with other great powers, besides Prussia/NGF/Germany and Austria/Austria-Hungary, until after 1890. This will help simulate the deep distrust the western powers of Britian and France had with the Russian empire for most of the 19th century. This will also likely have the effect of keeping Russia out of the Franco-Prussian wars, thus maintaining its stability better.
This will disable an event to prevent Russia from forming an alliance with other great powers, besides Prussia/NGF/Germany and Austria/Austria-Hungary, until after 1890.

It is the duty of the Government of this country, placed as it is with regard to geographical position, to keep itself upon terms of goodwill with all surrounding nations, but not to entangle itself with any single or monopolising alliance with any one of them, above all to endeavour not to interfere needlessly and vexatiously with the internal affairs of any foreign country. - Lord Edward Stanley, Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs. \n\nThe policy of 'splendid isolation' was characterised by Britain's reluctance to enter into permanent European alliances or commitments with the other great powers. During the late 19th century, Britain's primary goal in foreign policy was to maintain the balance of power in Europe and to intervene if that balance was upset. Its secondary goal was to protect its overseas interest in the colonies and dominions, as free trade kept the Empire alive.

Russia in the 19th century was diplomatically isolated from the Western European Empires by an intense, in hindsight, irrational fear of Russian designs on conquest of India and the whole of Eastern Europe, specifically the Balkans and the Dardanelles. This caused the western powers to intervene on the Ottomans side in the Crimean war, and Russia to not enter any allience with Britian or France until the last decade of the 19th century, once they shared a common foe in Germany.
The great Mother Empire stands splendidly isolated in Europe!
Russophobia has infested all levels of their government!
Permanently Hide all Options and 'Additional Features' Decisions
This decision will permanently hide the decisions for additional features to reduce clutter.
Extra pop growth for russia so it will reach near its hitorical population by 1900

English:
HPM crisis can be weird and white peace because the CB doesn't pass a check and invalidates it. I think this is what people reffered to as the truce bug.

I don't know why they made it like this.

Anyway this fixed it in all my tests.
This event converts all non-core/non-accepted craftsmen into farmers if they are on your cores. Part 2 will spawn in 3 days, be sure to select this option FIRST.
This event converts all 100% unemployed farmers into laborers.

Fix the craftsmen and bureaucrat bugs. The craftsmen bug is when you have a province that has craftsmen of a non-accepted culture and none of an accepted culture. It forces all promoting pops to become the culture of the craftsmen. The bureaucrats bug is even more annoying: bureaucrats of a non-accepted culture get payed by your government but don't add to administration efficiency, meaning that if that you're just throwing away money.
This will allow the Dismantlement CB to be used from the start of the game.
This will turn off the early use of the Dismantlement CB.
This will allow you to use the province selector to chose a state to core over 15 years.
This will turn off the ability to allow you to use the province selector to chose a state to core over 15 years.
This will cause the AI to use tariffs more effectively, making the AI have more money and be harder.
This will cause the AI to not use tariffs more effectively, making the AI have less money and be easier.
